RTF table generator

Converts NMR-STAR 3.1 chemical shift table to publication (rich text) format.

Project location: svn:///file/svn/websoft/rtfgen
website installation instructions

 

RTFgen

This is a quick and dirty PHP rewrite of an old Java application. It uses hand-coded RTF sequences and can only deal with 20 common amino-acids. The original was written when RTF was the only way to create tables with superscript Greek letters that could be imported into word processors. Nowadays more word processors can import HTML than RTF.

This version can handle "bare" chemical shift tables (from loop_ to stop_) in addition to complete NMR-STAR 3.1. files, and can process tables with multiple entities and multiple assigned chemical shift saveframes (note that this will only work with complete entries: a bare loop with shifts for multiple entities will result in one RTF table).

Publication format

Table with following columns:

  1. residue ID in XN format, e.g. A1
  2. C carbon chemical shift
  3. Cα carbon chemical shift
  4. Cβcarbon chemical shift
  5. other chemical shifts
For carbons, proton shifts are given in parentheses, with asterisk for missing value. "Other" column contains atom records: backbone atom ID followed by comma, followed by shift value, followed by proton shift in parentheses, as above. Multiple records are delimited with semicolons.

Hopefully journals are moving away from publishing chemical shifts in the articles and soon no one will use this format for anything.

Files

index.html and form.php: interface forms.

rtfgen.php: main program.

LoopParser.php: SANS parser for bare NMR-STAR loop.

StarParser.php and RTFGenParser.php: SANS parser for complete BMRB entry. Note that the script can process either a complete error-free BMRB entry or a bare loop. Entries with errors or files with multiple loops (but no saveframes etc.) will cause it to fail.

SampleCond.php and ShiftRow.php: data structures for holding sample conditions (used in table headers when converting complete entry) and chemical shift data.

rtf.php: RTF control sequences, string constants.

 

Last updated: 2008-12-17
